transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Hi Zhi, this is Arjun from MongoDB. Do you have a quick minute to chat about your ongoing migration at Acme Corp?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Hey Arjun. Honestly, we're in the middle of quite a few things, but go ahead.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: I'll keep it brief. I noticed Acme’s moving workloads right now. Are you open to hearing how Atlas could make multi-region failover or scaling easier than with PostgreSQL?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: I mean, we just spent six months migrating to PostgreSQL. Why would we consider another platform?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: That's fair. But a lot of AdTech companies run into bottlenecks with relational models—they need flexibility and global scaling. Atlas is built for that. Have you run into scaling pains yet?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Not really. Postgres is handling what we throw at it right now. And, honestly, I’m hesitant to disrupt things again.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Makes sense. But if you’re thinking about real-time bidding, geo-targeting, or regional data compliance, Atlas could help you future-proof.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Honestly, price is a bigger concern. We already got pushback on the database spend. Atlas just seems way more expensive and, uh, unpredictable cost-wise.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: I totally get that. We do see a higher sticker price up front, but operational costs can go down, especially with managed backups and automation.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Maybe, but it’s tough to justify migrating again—especially with our team just settling into Postgres.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Sure, but even a proof-of-concept could be low risk. If you’re planning more regions, Atlas offers instant failover, and compliance certifications are baked in.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: We’re not really expanding regions anytime soon. And the compliance stuff—we’re already ok on that front with our cloud provider.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Understood. Last question—would you be open to a short technical session if we could show a clear ROI and minimize the migration risk?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: I appreciate the offer, but honestly—not right now. We’re heads-down on other things and need to stay the course.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Got it. Thanks for being straight with me, Zhi. If anything changes—I’ll check back in down the line?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Sure, just not this quarter. Good luck, Arjun.
